content.detailedDescription: Starlike object moving in sky. too bright to be a star. mostly giving off blue light, but also red white & green light. then stayed stationary for over 30 minutes.
content.summary: Starlike object moving in sky. too bright to be a star. mostly giving off blue light, but also red white & green light. then stayed stationary for over 30 minutes.

content.detailedDescription: I was driving west on hwy 377 between granbury and tolar,tx around 7:30 on 2/21/12 looking towards the south west with my girlfriend. i noticed a bright flash of a light in the sky and it caught my attention. i waited about 10 seconds and then the lights became more apparent they were not air planes and one would light up the next to it another then the first would go away, then the lines became longer and more of them in different areas directing different ways but not too far from eachother. some of the main lights looked more of a red color. my girlfriend saw part of it but was only worried about sleeping. i have seen questionable lights in the past but never any like this or that many but have always been toward the stephenville area. but im not sure of how far they were from me just sure they were high in the air. i was too consumed with the lights to even think about grabbing my phone to try to record it. they seemed to just fade off not really flying anywhere or moving just hovering and glowing bright. i waited and watched for plane lights or small flashing lights from a jet or plane but never saw any.
content.summary: Bright white and red lights flashing in straight lines up to 7 or 8, many at a time.

content.detailedDescription: I had to take our dog out because he was crying at midnight. i had just finished watching a movie when he started so i took him out. i put on his leash and we were across the street by the cemetery by 12:05 . we went less than 2 blocks and we turned around. on our way back we came about a half a block and while he's doing his business  i was looking at the sky which i like to do and i noticed a large light in the sky followed by another then by another like the lights were circling but not moving . there were no lights coming from the ground and there was no noise . at first i thought it might be a helicopter but no noise. and i even waited to see if the noise of a helicopter might come a little later but it didn't . anyway these lights continued to rotate as i walked closer toward home and then they started to move west ? toward burmont rd. i stood outside and watched  while these rotating lights moved away. when i came in i told my wife who was up late making a cake for her bosses birthday but when we went out back the lights were no longer visible. and that is my ufo story. very strange. i never thought i would write such a thing but it was too weird to just blow off.
content.summary: Large lights rotating in the sky with no noise and no light projecting from the ground .

content.detailedDescription:
After the initial event of the 5 objects visible at once with the strobing lights (6) flashing v shaped from left to right, then there were single glows starting at southwest of my position from hiway 4 and the stephenville rd then south southwest then in the middle of the two previous. they did not flash like a beacon but flared on and off in the span of 2 seconds like a glow on and off. the color was red orange.
i know what flares look like and there is no flare that can reach 10 to 12 thousand feet. they were statioary  the event lasted for the 30 minutes i was at the intersection. the event appereared to be over the stephenville area
content.summary: V shaped strobe orange red lights left to right 5 objects then one object at a time southwest then one south southwest then center,

content.detailedDescription: it was metallic color, round, and stationary, in the sky. i called my friend over to take a look.  he also said he saw it.
content.summary: I was flying a kite at a park in hermosa beach. i was watching the kite, looking east.

content.detailedDescription:
2-21-12
bluish green orb
6:45pm. just getting dark

i was in orlando @ freedom high school in my semi when i 
noticed a bluish green orb dancing around in the sky over 
a heavily populated area. the orb would rise and fall and 
move from side to side and to a far distance and back.

i watched this for 2-3 minutes until it just went away. 
i was approx 1 mile from it. it averaged 50' to 300' in
altitude. 

i did get 2 videos and 1 picture.
content.summary: Blue/green orb in orlando

content.detailedDescription: Feb. 21 2012 is the 7th time i have observed this brilliant light moving nw thru the sky  at 6:50 pm, i first saw the light slightly north and very low on the horizon a great distance beneath polaris. as the light traveled in a nw direction, at approx. 8:45 it began to slowly descend and at 9:04 it disappeared below the treeline/nw slope of a nearby mountain.
content.summary: Feb. 21 2012 is the 7th time i have observed this brilliant light moving nw thru the sky and slowly descending and disappearing below treeline/mountain slope.

content.detailedDescription: I was at my son football pratice and i was recording it and i notice something glowing took my recorder and start recording it i have very good fotage of it no fake must see, this is my second time reporting this with no respond please get in touch with me u wont be sorry.
content.summary: Very real

content.detailedDescription: I was on the uncw campus laying down on on the fountain talking on the phone when i saw the ufo. it was a clear night with many stars and i saw a gigantic black and gray object move incredibly fast from behind me to far out in front of me till i couldn't see it anymore in less than 5 seconds. i was stunned at how fast it went and it was pretty low but still higher than nearby airplanes. it was the color of the sky with a gray outline and was moving in a straight line. i quickly ran back to my dorm.
content.summary: Flew silently directly overhead across entire sky in less than 10 seconds

content.detailedDescription: at 7:27 pm on 2/21/12 i recieved a phone call from a friend. my young children were being prepared for bed by my wife and i so i stepped into my garage to talk on the phone in quiet. i live in rural area in western erath county, texas on a farm that we purchased in part for it's southern and western view (we can see for approx 40-60 miles in either direction). as i spoke with my friend two unbelievably bright lights appeared at about 15-20 degrees above the horizon no more than 1 mile above my pasture. at first i thought they were engines on a large jet that was apparently crashing coming straight north toward my house. they then disappeared, followed by what looked like fireworks with a trail after they disappeared. almost immediately afterward ten to fifteen of the brilliant lights appeared in a straight row at equal distances across the sky from east to west. the light began in the middle and went out in both directions, hovered for 20 seconds and disappeared. i yelled for my wife and when she came small flashing lights were all over the sky moving in ways we have never seen an airplane operate; up, down, sideways. the same or a very similar process as the first happened again a few minutes later to the east with both my wife and i watching. soon afterward we heard jets in the night sky but did not see them. also, while this entire event happened there was low hum and sometimes an odd rumble. we are very rational, calm, college educated adults. we don't know what we saw other than very strange lights. i started writing this less than 1 hour after it happened.
content.flightPath: Hovering then path,Straight-line path,Path with directional change
content.summary: Dozens of small flashing lights southern sky followed by unbelievable brightness in sequence and independently.

content.detailedDescription: Actual date, uncertain if 1995 or 1996. the oakland press (pontiac mi) had a feature the nest day describing 20 reports to waterford airport, supposedly a "helicopter". beginning about 11:30 pm, looking west from an area in waterford mi near the clarkston border, we were looking nw at a spot above pontiac lake--the lake, not the road of the same name. i thought i was seeing a helicopter about to ascend, it had a sort of rotation to it, but then changed lighting upon each rotation and appeared to change in size and shape. actual shapes of all objects on this sighting were difficult to determine due to it being night, and the formation of the lights. it looked extremely odd, i pointed it out to my friend, the object ascended noiselessly and vanished into the dark. shortly afterward, a group of three 3-light (triangle-shape to lighting formation) smaller objects came into view, and 'danced' around in a manner like insects, sporadically blinking out and reappearing elsewhere. sometimes 1, or 2, never more than 3 visible at any one time. large object was still not seen again (yet). at one point, one of the small objects flew in an arc, then split into two and rejoined, all in the same arc--which confirmed that we were seeing something amazing here. no noises from these at any time. later daylight travel suggested that these were likely no farther than 1/2 mile away, but were much closer, too. at one point, a brightly lighted globe was visible from direct west, sort of floating as if on a direct track, revolving in slow motion. as it came toward us, it was visible as a dark purple-pink--red globe with bands of bluish 'electrical bolts' coursing over its surface. it flew directly over us at a height of about 12-15 feet from the ground, lighting two houses in red light from is glow, and the object maybe have been 3-5 in diameter, kept going to the east until no longer visible. more activity from the small lights and the on/off behavior and fast movement was viewed. then the large object approached from direct west from within a half-mile. it had a difficult-to-define wedge/triangle shape, pulsing color and size, and my friend pointed out a hazy blue 'whirlwind' underneath it that you could see was picking up debris: paper, branches, etc. i marked visual haze that in the form as 'cloud', though it wasn't smoke or vapor. while looking at that (like a desert heat haze, but bluish and opaque and moving) 'whirlwind', a couple of small 'shooting star' objects came off of the large object and went to the ground. it came closer, to within about 100 feet of where we were, and was right over a nearby house, illuminating it in deep red. at that point the object may have appeared to be greater than 60-70' long, but it's shape and size 'morphed' all the time. so when it was above the house, i said "i'm going!" and ran right toward it. jumping a fence, a dog barked, it took off and 'vanished,' but reappeared several minutes later, the last time we saw anything that night. i'm absolutely certain we were treated to something extraordinary. these were not normal aircraft (we even saw a cargo plane during all this at far higher altitude, heard it, and knew what it was immediately--these were not 'helicopters'!). again, no audible noises, and it was a very quiet night overall. area is semi-rural but sporadically developed, near highway i-75 and other major roads, several miles west of pontiac. temperature was maybe mid-40sf, extremely clear night, no visible clouds at all, and the sky in that area has a broad visibility range, no light pollution in that area. from the first sighting to the last moment, this ran at least 45 minutes. it was full of such stunning moments that it made me laugh at other ufo incidents that were minimal at best: we were given quite a show. number of witnesses represents our sighting, but the newspaper reported 20 calls (and we didn't call, so many saw this).
content.distance: 20 Feet or Less, 21-100 Feet, 501 Feet - 1 Mile
content.flightPath: Hovering then path,Straight-line path,Path with directional change,Path then hovering
content.summary: I would have never guessed this would happen, but

content.detailedDescription: Ufo appeared out of nowhere hovered and then zoomed off in the blink of an eye. soon after a jet and then a black helicopter appeared in the area and i was asked if i saw anything by some random guy in a black lexus i said no and asked w"why are you looking for something and he said "no i thought i saw a fox" there are no foxes around here guy looked like an fbi agent or something.
content.summary: Ufo appeared out of nowhere hovered and then zoomed off in the blink of an eye

content.detailedDescription: I was standing outside smoking a cigarette, when i saw something glowing orange in the sky, it looked different than the stars or airplanes.  it went across the sky then looked as if like a flame it burned out.  i looked for another 5 mins to see if i could spot it again and i didnt.  it looked like it was moving about the speed of the airplanes in the sky.
content.summary: It looked like a flame going across the sky. then it seemed as if it burned out.

content.detailedDescription: I was taking pictures of the moon when i noticed an object floating in the air.  i took the picture as it was heading in a northerly direction. i've seen several of these in my area.
content.summary: Rope like object hovered then flew away at slow rate of speed

content.detailedDescription: Out side, 4 nights in a row now. look like stars, then see movement, in every fashion. i knew it was a ufo, have seen several since moving here last october. object, appears as a star. then moves around, up, down, back, forth, diagonal, circular. goes & stops on a dime. the first time, i wondered if my eyes were playing tricks on me. but, i quickly realized what i was seeing. this isn't the first time. so, i feel thrilled & happy. don't want to take my eyes off of them. i lose sight when either moring comes, or i fall asleep. they move with the stars. keep a general position.
content.flightPath: Stationary,Hovering then path,Straight-line path,Path with directional change,Path then hovering
content.summary: Like the stars were dancing

content.detailedDescription:
On feburary 10th 2012, i went outside, my garage was open, kids were playing outside, it was about 7:30ish, the sun was down...I stood by the edge of my garage and looked up as i always do.
i saw jupiter a little to my right...(west view) then another star next to that..Sort of aligned, then what i thought was another star, which was the ufo, it just didn't seem to belong so i starred at it. 
the oldest kid outside was 14 yrs. old, as i starred at this so called star,  it then started to move, sort of like an orb would kind of erratic, wobbly, as though my vision wasn't clear, but it was. then 
i pointed at it to show my cousin (14 yr. old) and her friend who was 13yrs old, i believe.  they watched with me as it then started to move northeast. at the same time a plane flew over and it had it's blinking lights so i compared to the other ufo, mind you the ufo was moving steadily but very slow the ufo had no blinking lights it kept it's starlike appearance the whole time. we watched it till it faded away, three last things i noticed, there was no sound, as it turned off the star like light it had a reddish hue not light...So that may have been it's surface color...Also we live near bush airport, so planes are flying frequently through here, this object seemed to be below the planes level, but it's light was equivalent with jupiter's brightness at this time. sort of gave me a feeling of fear, because before i came out, the kids were the only ones out there, and they shouldn't of been out by themselves...It seemed to be just hovering...Maybe observing...But it gave me an uneasy feeling.
content.summary: Simulating a star, bright clean white

content.detailedDescription: On monday, feb. 20, 2012 at approx. 6:50 pm i observed a (6x) recurring brilliant light,in the western sky low in the horizon, possibly 6-800 ft. above ground. after approx 30 min., the light had moved in a nw path with slight decline in elev.And continued this trend until 10:22 pm, at which time the light began to noticibly descend toward the nw slope of a nearby mountain.  by 10:35 p.M. the light had dropped below the treeline.
content.summary: On monday, feb. 20, 2012 at approx. 6:50 pm i observed a (6x) recurring brilliant light, low in the horizon, possibly 6-800 ft. above ground. after approx 30 min., the light had moved in a nw path with slight decline in elev.And cont. this trend until 10:

Mufon, you guys know ufo's are real...Why don't you do more to get the word out. do the government fund mufon or something?

content.detailedDescription: At 4:30 in the morning, i let my dog outside. i was standing at the door waiting for him to come back in when i saw 4 or 5 solid red lights in a row with a flashing white light on the rear. it was traveling faster than i have ever seen an airplane travel over my house and appeared a lot closer. it was traveling from the north west to the south east. i watched it until it was no longer visible because of the roof of my house. i checked with an online satellite website and found there was no aircraft in the immediate area. i printed a copy of the radar image and the flight number of the closest aircraft. the weather was 33 degrees f. with clear skies.
content.summary: 4 or 5 solid red lights in a row with a flashing white light on the rear

content.detailedDescription:
I was letting the dog out around 10:30 pm est. i'm in a quiet residential neighborhood in lansdale, pa. as i often do, i was looking into the night sky while he sniffed around for a good spot to relieve himself. i turned and called him to the other side of the front lawn and was immediately taken back by the enormity of this bright white/orange/yellow object that hung in the sky above the house across the street. i had no idea what it could be! it was shining much brighter - and was clearly larger - than any star i would see from earth. it certainly didn't resemble any flight crafts that i had ever seen either. 

my first thought was that it could be a flaming meteor that was  extremely close to earth's orbit and was perhaps also reflecting the sun; so i watched it more intently to examine its path... but it didn't move at all. i stared at this thing for about 10 seconds, making sure i was stable on my feet to ensure the accuracy of my understanding. but it still didn't move! then, i affixed a line of sight against the tip of a thin naked tree branch that was located across the street. another 10 seconds elapsed and i was able to track only a very slight, slow ascent. 

during this time, i had also been monitoring the objects light characteristics, searching for signs that it was perhaps just an extraordinarily well lit plane, or helicopter, or balloon - anything that i would otherwise be able to identify. but it was not, by any means, anything i could assume be in the sky this close to a residential area. (note: i was unable to determine with much certainty it's proximity to my location. taking a mathematical guess, i would say it was about 200-400 feet above ground and between 1-2 miles in distance; but then again, i wouldn't be surprised if somehow i learned that it was, in fact, a meteor well outside the earth's atmosphere - but it was much too bright and had so little movement!)

anxious to get someone else's perspective, i rushed into the house to bring another set of eyes onto this magnificent object. it had moved so little during my observation that i figured, surely, i could bring my family out one at a time, if i needed. i first grabbed my mother-in-law, who was just in the kitchen, and rushed her outside! not more than 15 seconds passed while i hurried inside and returned to the front yard. but, sure enough, by the time we emerged from the house, this unbelievable object had inexplicably disappeared.
content.summary: Large, bright, star-like object hovering.

content.detailedDescription:
I just saw some very interesting footage while watching a reality tv show. it aired today at 11pm on monday february 20 2012 on direct tv channel 236 in new mexico. 
during the episode the camera goes to the la skyline when a very fast moving object could be seen flying right above the skyline very bright and very fast.  it looked like if was changing speeds as it changed in length as it flew across.  this was captured on video and i believe is worth investigating!

i am a police officer in albuquerque nm and this object is the most interesting thing i have ever seen and since it is a reality tv show i don't see why it would be faked and really can't see what else it could be so close to the skyline and going so fast!
content.summary: Ufo captured on video going across city skyline

content.detailedDescription:
May 4th, 2011 near dusk while watching television and facing open window, noticed movement outside.  noticed two orbs flying synchronously by window. yellow orange glowing orb of about tennis ball size accompanied by red smaller orb. red orb was partially obscured by yellow orb. both seemingly solid objects glowed though i did not note reflected light on ground outside window or glare on window panes.  objects traveled approx north to south in straight unwavering line approx 2-3 feet high over yard. exact speed unknown though approximately that of a fast walk .. enough for me to note inside house through window and observe colors, size and direction and general position over the ground and just past my porch.
  
no observable physiological or psychological effect on myself or missing time.  unable to note further path of object as it was gone by the time i made it to window, though oddly, within thirty seconds of object passing -white- fireflies began to rise all over yard. fireflies in this area tend to be yellowish in color and very few are noted at once in one area.  approx 10-15 were noted rising in small backyard area.  orbs seen were not fireflies, remained lit or glowing entire 6-10 seconds of view time and were simply too large to be considered phosphorescent bugs.

my first thought isn't remembered though several things passed my mind in quick succession. i, rather wonderingly considered them potential 'probes' of some sort or some sort of unknown flight-capable object.  i dismissed the thought of tennis or children's balls having been tossed over a neighboring fence as they flew parallel to the ground ( no arc whatsoever was noted in their path)and were within 25-30 feet of where i sat. my window is wide and some sort of arc would have been noted or likely the bounce of one of them, had they been thrown objects. their height from the ground was wrong for this as well, due to the height of the fence that abuts that side of the yard. by the time i saw them, they were at least 12-15 feet away from the 6 foot fenceline and flew in a straight line, not 2-3 feet over the earth. no balls were found afterwards. fireflies were also dismissed due to the continuously glowing nature of the objects and their varying colors. the white lights that i assumed to be fireflies that rose afterwards were white in color, very wispy in nature and tended to fly slowly upwards, their lights diminishing within a small second or two as they rose. i am also familiar with 'spirit lights' or 'orbs' of the paranormal genre though these did not seem transparent and did not meander in their path as most depictions of such orbs are said to do.

my feelings? i was rather shocked though intrigued and curious. i felt -no- fear strangely enough though kept my seat for a long few seconds after it passed. though i was not exactly fearful i was cautious and sat there long enough for it to, hopefully, make its way out of my backyard. just before i rose, i noticed the fireflies beginning to rise so grabbed up my cell phone, called a friend who is interested in such things and watched the fireflies rise as i told him about the possible sighting.

i later exited the house and looked for any sign of the things though by this time the sun was down and, despite my porch lights illuminating the porch outside, i could see little. there were no other signs left by the next day or so, either on the ground under its basic flight path or on the fences to either side that abut my yard.

i later reported this to a local texas based investigator.
content.summary: Two small orbs, yellow in front tennisball sized, red beside it about golfball sized.

content.detailedDescription: Outside with the dogs. facing east no clouds at 7pm observed bright star-like object to lower left of pollux it was as bright and about same size as sirius.  the constant and bright round light moved upwards toward the zenith then when it was just slightly higher than pollux it pulsed brighter and larger, it returned to original size and continued upwards until almost on same level with castor and pulsed again even larger still then moved up to a level even with or slightly higher than castor and pulsed even larger and brighter than the first two times and vanished. to provide an idea of the duration i had time to say the following in my head. hello... what are you doing there?, oh you're moving! you're not a plane... whoa!That was bright, up again, whoa! what a flash! what are you??? are you kidding me?? wow! where'd you go? i watched for another 15 minutes but did not see it again.
content.summary: Facing east no clouds at 7pm observed bright star-like object to lower left of pollux light moved upwards toward the zenith just above pollux and pulsed brighter and larger, it returned to original size and continued upwards almost even with castor....

content.detailedDescription: Was walking from the barn to the house with my mom and we saw a bright light come up from the horizion about the size of my pinkey finger nail at arms leinght  the light rose up fast and then hovered for 3 to 5 sce and then disapeared , i then went in the house for 15 to 20 sce and when i came out i saw another light just north of where i saw the fost one it rose fast hovered for 5 or so sec and then went in a sraight line away form me fast but staied above the horizion untill it blended in with the stars . at the time there was 5 or more palnes in the sky at verring distance, none looked any thing like eather one , there color that i can colsely describe is that of the red-orange of hot steal or hot caols ina fire ,my mom asked me what it was i said i have no idea , i have seen a few other strang thing in the sky so i have a habit of looking when i am outside , every one that i have seen in in the same genral eara of the sky this is the 4 or 5 ufo i have seen this year alone
content.summary: Two bright orange red light in sky

content.detailedDescription: I was driving north on north main street in plains, pa at 6:15 pm on feb. 20. i noticed a bright white light hovering over some houses in the distance, maybe about 1/4 mile away. it was dark and i had no depth perception. it could have been very close or very far away; i couldnt tell. at first, i thought it was an approaching aircraft, because to the north about 10 miles lies the wilkes-barre/scranton airport. the light disappeared and then quickly reappeared to the east. it stayed bright for a second, disappeared and then reappeared near its original spot. it stayed bright again for a second, disappeared and then reappeared to the west, all in quick succession. it then disappeared completely from sight. this all lasted about six seconds. i have never seen anything like this before. the light seemed to bounce back and forth across the sky and then just disappeared.
content.flightPath: Hovering then path,Path with directional change
content.summary: Saw white light or lights alternately appear and disappear quickly for a few seconds
